attributes.action: Revoke the use of 'Acoustic/Noise' Camera's on British Roads.
attributes.additional_details:
Road users feel victimised once again with the introduction of the idea whereby a more noisy vehicle will be penalised financially and probably also with points to their license if their vehicle is to activate said equipment. Speaking from a Motorcyclists POV, loud bikes save lives - since it alerts other road users to our smaller presence. 

So long as a vehicle can pass an MOT inspection within the noise restrictions, additional penalties ideas are wholesomely rejected by all that have signed.
attributes.background: The introduction of the testing of Acoustic Camera's on our highways has been met with uproar on social media from driver's of all vehicles.
